sourceDesc.p: This is the feature-file for presentatives f.sg. (HERE IT IS, not there).

revisionDesc.change: For EGY-___ there are no values found
updating references to Zotero IDs via update-bibl-refs.xsl

cit.quote: here we have our system of justice
the dibdēbah here is for the Flathead greymullet

wib:featureValueObservation.note: Increasing use of invariable "da", which in initial position has a presentative function (Roth 1979:169)
təmma is the existential particle, but when followed by a pronoun it has a "presentative nuance"
According to Holes (2006), kā- can be prefixed to any pronoun
According to Holes (2007), kā- can be prefixed to any pronoun
This form was recorded in the village of Ḥaydān, its masculine counterpart is ḏāḥēk.
This form was recorded in Naḏ̣īr, its masculine counterpart is ḏīḥēk.
The hā itself is gender neutral, gender and number are determined by the pronoun.
This seems to be a gender neutral interjection.
